MainCategory.Description: Technical Skills & Experience: Assesses the candidate's proficiency in required and preferred technologies, programming languages, and tools necessary for software development and system configuration.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review the candidate's resume and experience, focusing on their proficiency with C#, .NET, SQL, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and other relevant technologies. Evaluate their experience with software development methodologies, database management, and web technologies. Assess their familiarity with A/B testing, usability studies, performance tuning, and HIPAA compliance, and their experience with cloud platforms.
MainCategory.Justification: Essential for performing the core responsibilities of the role, including software development, system configuration, and technical problem-solving. Aligns with both the Main JD (Skills and Credentials) and Candidate JD (Required and Preferred Skills).

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no experience with required technologies. Lacks fundamental skills and knowledge.
Some experience with required technologies, but may require guidance and training. Demonstrates basic proficiency.
Proficient in required technologies and demonstrates a strong understanding of software development principles. Can independently contribute to projects.
Expert in required technologies and demonstrates advanced skills and knowledge. Can lead projects and mentor others.

MainCategory.Description: Problem-Solving & Troubleshooting: Assesses the candidate's ability to identify, analyze, and resolve technical issues related to software and systems.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's experience in troubleshooting complex technical problems. Assess their problem-solving approach, analytical skills, and ability to identify root causes and implement effective solutions. Use behavioral interview questions to assess their past experiences in resolving challenging technical issues.
MainCategory.Justification: Crucial for maintaining system stability, resolving customer issues, and ensuring the smooth operation of software applications. Directly mentioned in the Main JD (Strong troubleshooting skills) and emphasized in the Candidate JD (Examining existing systems for flaws and creating solutions).

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited problem-solving skills. Struggles to identify and resolve technical issues.
Demonstrates basic problem-solving skills. Can resolve simple technical issues with guidance.
Strong problem-solving skills. Can independently identify, analyze, and resolve complex technical issues.
Expert problem-solving skills. Can handle the most complex and challenging technical issues with ease and efficiency.

MainCategory.Description: Communication & Collaboration: Assesses the candidate's ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences, and to collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's communication skills through the interview process. Assess their ability to clearly and concisely explain technical concepts. Assess their experience working in a team environment and their ability to collaborate with others to achieve common goals. Ask behavioral interview questions to assess their past experiences in communicating and collaborating with stakeholders.
MainCategory.Justification: Essential for effectively working with internal teams, external customers, and stakeholders to understand requirements, propose solutions, and deliver high-quality software. Highlighted in the Main JD (Strong communication skills) and Candidate JD (Collaborate with global team).

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor communication skills. Struggles to communicate technical information effectively and has difficulty collaborating with others.
Demonstrates basic communication skills. Can communicate technical information with some clarity and can collaborate with others with guidance.
Strong communication skills. Can effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences and can collaborate effectively with team members and stakeholders.
Exceptional communication skills. Can communicate technical information with clarity and persuasiveness and is a highly effective collaborator.

MainCategory.Description: Software Development Lifecycle & Best Practices: Assesses the candidate's understanding and experience in applying software development methodologies, coding standards, and best practices throughout the development lifecycle.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's knowledge of software development methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, and Scrum. Evaluate their understanding of coding standards, testing methodologies, and version control systems. Ask behavioral interview questions to assess their past experiences in applying software development best practices.
MainCategory.Justification: Ensures that software is developed efficiently, effectively, and with high quality, adhering to industry standards and company policies. Referenced in the Main JD (participate in all facets of software and system development life-cycle) and explicitly mentioned in the Candidate JD (Plan and execute full software development lifecycle).

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of software development methodologies and best practices.
Demonstrates basic understanding of software development methodologies and best practices, but may require guidance.
Strong understanding of software development methodologies and best practices. Can independently apply them to projects.
Expert knowledge of software development methodologies and best practices. Can mentor others and drive process improvements.

MainCategory.Description: Adaptability & Learning Agility: Assesses the candidate's willingness and ability to adapt to new technologies, learn quickly, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's willingness to learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements. Evaluate their ability to quickly acquire new skills and knowledge. Ask behavioral interview questions to assess their past experiences in adapting to new situations and learning new technologies.
MainCategory.Justification: Critical for keeping up with the rapidly evolving technology landscape and contributing to innovative solutions. Aligns with the need for a 'fast learner' in the Main JD and the 'Desire to continue professional growth through training and education' in the Candidate JD.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Resistant to change and slow to learn new technologies.
Willing to learn new technologies, but may require significant guidance and support.
Quickly learns new technologies and adapts to changing requirements with ease.
Highly adaptable and demonstrates a passion for learning new technologies. Proactively seeks out opportunities to improve skills and knowledge.

SubCategory.Description: Code Quality & Review: Assesses the candidate's ability to write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code, and their experience with code review processes.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's coding samples for clarity, efficiency, and adherence to coding standards. Assess their experience with code review processes and their ability to provide constructive feedback.  Incorporate coding exercises into the interview process.
SubCategory.Justification: Ensures code is reliable, efficient, and easy to maintain. Improves collaboration and reduces the risk of errors. Derived from Candidate JD and interview questions about code quality process.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Code is poorly written, difficult to understand, and lacks documentation.
Code is generally readable and functional, but may have some areas for improvement.
Code is clean, well-documented, and easy to maintain. Demonstrates strong coding skills and experience with code review processes.

SubCategory.Description: Testing & Debugging: Assesses the candidate's experience with software testing methodologies and debugging tools, and their ability to identify and resolve software defects.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's knowledge of software testing methodologies such as unit testing, integration testing, and regression testing. Evaluate their experience with debugging tools and their ability to identify and resolve software defects. Ask behavioral interview questions to assess their past experiences in testing and debugging software.
SubCategory.Justification: Ensures software is reliable and free of defects. Reduces the risk of errors and improves user satisfaction. Related to the Candidate JD skills requirements and interview questions regarding spotting bugs.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited experience with software testing and debugging. Struggles to identify and resolve software defects.
Demonstrates basic understanding of software testing and debugging. Can identify and resolve simple software defects with guidance.
Strong experience with software testing and debugging. Can independently identify and resolve complex software defects using appropriate tools and methodologies.

SubCategory.Description: Database Management: Assesses the candidate's experience with database technologies such as Microsoft SQL Server, T-SQL, ODBC, and SQL Reporting Services.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's experience with database technologies. Assess their ability to design and implement database schemas, write SQL queries, and optimize database performance.  Include database-related questions in the technical interview.
SubCategory.Justification: Essential for developing and maintaining data-driven applications. Aligns with the Main JD's 'Hands-on experience with database technologies' and the Candidate JD's 'Working knowledge of relational databases'.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited experience with database technologies. Struggles to write basic SQL queries.
Demonstrates basic understanding of database technologies. Can write simple SQL queries and design basic database schemas with guidance.
Strong experience with database technologies. Can independently design and implement database schemas, write complex SQL queries, and optimize database performance.

SubCategory.Description: Web Technologies: Assesses the candidate's experience with web technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Web Services, ADO, ADO.NET, and IIS.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's experience with web technologies. Assess their ability to develop web applications using these technologies. Include web technology-related questions in the technical interview. Assess the candidate's knowledge of modern web development frameworks and libraries.
SubCategory.Justification: Critical for developing web-based applications and interfaces. Directly mentioned in the Main JD's 'Savvy in Web Technologies' and Candidate JD's 'Proficiency with HTML5, CSS3, and content management systems'.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited experience with web technologies. Struggles to write basic JavaScript code or create HTML/CSS layouts.
Demonstrates basic understanding of web technologies. Can write simple JavaScript code and create basic HTML/CSS layouts with guidance.
Strong experience with web technologies. Can independently develop web applications using these technologies and has a good understanding of modern web development frameworks and libraries.

SubCategory.Description: Teamwork & Collaboration Skills: Evaluates the candidate's ability to work effectively within a team environment, contributing to shared goals and supporting colleagues.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Use behavioral questions to assess the candidate's past teamwork experiences. Evaluate their ability to communicate effectively, resolve conflicts, and contribute to a positive team dynamic. Ask the candidate to describe their ideal team environment.
SubCategory.Justification: Enhances productivity and innovation. Essential for delivering complex projects and maintaining a positive work environment. This is reinforced in interview questions provided by Candidate JD asking to describe the trait your ideal product team would have.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Demonstrates poor teamwork skills. Struggles to collaborate with others and contribute to team goals.
Demonstrates basic teamwork skills. Can work with others with guidance, but may struggle in challenging situations.
Demonstrates strong teamwork skills. Can effectively collaborate with others, contribute to team goals, and resolve conflicts constructively.
